website_summaries.verdict: A great resource for graphic designers looking to increase their knowledge of and skills with designing logos and creating brand identities.
pros: Offers tips for designing effective logos, explaining why some logos are more effective than others, and how to turn that into a total brand identity
Also includes advice for working with clients and how to manage those relationships
cons: Not ideal for those brand new to graphic design who are looking for something about the fundamentals of design

customer_reviews.title: a must read for freelancers and newbies
customer_reviews.text: I have been designing logos for years and this book still gave me excellent pointers, tips and perspectives which I wish I had from the get go. Practical and effective examples help guide you to achieving success in your attempts to creating iconic designs for clients.
customer_reviews.author: Buji

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Insight for the Student of Design
customer_reviews.text: This book fills many blanks that might have been left during a formal art education. This book provides several examples of professional logos, and includes rough sketches that demonstrate the design process. There is other insight provided as well, such as dealing with clients, negotiating price, dealing with pitfalls. I recommend this book for anyone considering a career in the design industry. If you're a student and are considering design as a career path, then I highly recommend adding this to your reading material. It'll be worth the extra time. Be sure to have a notebook handy; you'll need it!
customer_reviews.author: I Hunter

customer_reviews.title: From concepts to clients Logo Design Love demystifies graphic design.
customer_reviews.text: If you're curious about a career as a graphic designer, this book lays it all out from formulating concepts to dealing with clients. Logo Design Love demystifies graphic design while it inspires creativity. I really enjoyed this book.
customer_reviews.author: Six

customer_reviews.title: Not just logo design, great identity design book
customer_reviews.text: I was really pleased with how extensive this book is on the identity design process, without being over-complicated or feeling the need to over-explain itself. Not just an explanation of logo design, it includes a succinct analysis of and process for creating a brand identity for clients, as well as great professional guidance for working with clients.
customer_reviews.author: Kim G.

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: A lot of useful information for logo design. I found the parts on pricing and the process more useful than the "how to design a logo" part. The "how to" part was basic information catered to non-designers. Overall, a good and quick read with great examples on many different types of clients.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!
customer_reviews.text: Cool Text Book. As a Graphic Design Instructor, I utilize this book for my class in Corporate Identification.
customer_reviews.author: Frank X. West Palm Beach

customer_reviews.title: Gift to artist
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter; she has a BFA and she is an artist and photographer. She wanted to learn more about logo design and I read a lot of reviews and picked out this book. She has since read it and she tells me that it is a great book for the topic of logo design.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great book that follows and discusses some of the most ...
customer_reviews.text: A great book that follows and discusses some of the most popular logo designs as well is a great insight into the process of making a succesful branding.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander King

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful book condition
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful book condition, great advices and information about brand identity, logos, and so much more! Loving the book already upon arrival! Came faster than it's suppose to! Happy!
customer_reviews.author: kani79

customer_reviews.title: Useful for the Browser and the Reader Alike
customer_reviews.text: Great book that shows the sketches of a resulting logo with commentary about the process and the end result. Also, as you would think, it's laid out clearly and logically so you can flip through it quickly and then come back to something if you want to read about it in detail.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ho

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s been really helpful to me as I’m starting my own logo business. I highly recommend it whether you are just starting or you want to keep developing your skills.
customer_reviews.author: Tea

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Really love this book. It opened my eyes on a few things I was doing wrong. Helpful for people who want to learn more as a designer
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: <3 LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I finally purchased a copy of this helpful and enlightening book, LOGO DESIGN LOVE / second edition. I couldn't be more pleased with it. With the vast amount of insight and behind the scenes creativity David presents, the outcome is phenomenal. So, yeah... thank you for this brilliant book and keep up the great work, Mr. Airey!
customer_reviews.author: C. Venuto

customer_reviews.title: Should’ve gotten this a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: I graduated this past May in the Graphic Design program and met a lot of great people, I should’ve gotten this book back in 2017 when I started studying Graphic Design!
customer_reviews.author: Giselle Guevara

customer_reviews.title: Neat book
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a good introduction to design, combining reasonable advice with multiple case studies. I enjoyed reading it and would recommend it to anyone interested in branding.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for designers
customer_reviews.text: So happy to be adding this to my collection of graphic design books.
customer_reviews.author: Pea

customer_reviews.title: Are ya a designer or want to be one? Get this book.
customer_reviews.text: Well written, entertaining, lots of tips, a lot to learn from this, supports the K.I.S.S theory. Must have for actual and future graphic designers.
customer_reviews.author: Maximiliano Ovalle

customer_reviews.title: Great Design Info and then sum...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 3/4 way through this book and I must say it has certainly over-delivered. I bought it to help with logo design but it has also given me much more insight on overall design. The information is definitely applicable to not just logo design, but design in general. David
customer_reviews.author: David Flemming

customer_reviews.title: Purchased the book and absolutely loved it! I recently decided to take my craft ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the book and absolutely loved it! I recently decided to take my craft seriously and it gave me alot of insight into things I always questioned. I loved the examples given and the look, feel and the presentation was great. I have highlights in mine lol. Good job...great book...MUST BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More for the serious enthusiast.
customer_reviews.text: Useful to a certain extent, so far as getting ideas. It's not for dabblers.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Ramos Mattei

customer_reviews.title: Good book, shipped fast
customer_reviews.text: Book in great condition, fast shipping. The book itself is an amazing and thorough look at Branding would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Proteau

customer_reviews.title: Solid book
customer_reviews.text: Fun and informative. Contains several real-world case studies. Plenty of images too. Overall, Logo Design Love was a satisfying read.
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Latimer

customer_reviews.title: Great book, easy read
customer_reviews.text: A valuable book by all standards, reading this was easy with a lot of examples that drive home the point
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Detailed
customer_reviews.text: I like how this book was able to give me a glimpse on how top notch designers work their magic behind the scenes. Would recommend to those who are looking to take their game a step higher.
customer_reviews.author: Christon

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this book! Provides great tips, examples, and wonderful strategies used by the author in his experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one
customer_reviews.text: This is a great source of reference material. Enjoyable to read and absorb
customer_reviews.author: Carleen Carrasco

customer_reviews.title: Great Read!
customer_reviews.text: If you design logos or ever plan to, this book is for you. It's packed with good information and great examples to back them up.
customer_reviews.author: Marv

customer_reviews.title: Love the book
customer_reviews.text: Love the book! I am learning so much and I am very happy I decided to purchase the book based on the reviews I read! A very simple and direct way to understanding the designing of logos.~LM
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It came in pretty quick for delivery
customer_reviews.text: I just forgot I had ordered this book along with another one. It came in pretty quick for delivery! I also got into reading up on some tips and guidelines. Very pleased with this book if you're into Logo Creation or Graphic Design. I already recommended this to a friend of mine! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for a class. It arrived quickly and undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: ReiNitalia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and relevant.
customer_reviews.text: David's writing is clear, concise and funny. A must-have book for anyone who designs logos or brand identities.
customer_reviews.author: January

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great advice and tool for Graphic Designers. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Javed Uddin

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent book, great tips and great examples. I would recommend it to anyone that wants to design a logo.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Damewood

customer_reviews.title: Work and passion of a graphic designer
customer_reviews.text: The book is a new edition of a best seller book about graphic design. I haven't read the previous edition but I totally recomend this one as a great tool for graphic designer. It shows the full work process of designing a brand: passions, inspirations, finding and managing a client, and getting paid.
customer_reviews.author: stefano ricci

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book
customer_reviews.text: Full of insights for those who's just starting out in graphic design and wants to understand the process of logo design or for those already in the feild who wants to expand their knowledge further.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Great book if you want to work in design
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this but full of titips and insights into the process of logo design but it was really helpful in conveying what it's like to work as a professional designer. I also thought it was generally well written. Not overly technical but definitely not to simple.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Great Introduction for Novice Designers
customer_reviews.text: The advice David gives is from his professional experience in logo design and brand marketing, but it can be valuable for any freelancer who wants to work more effectively with a client.
customer_reviews.author: John Burnham

customer_reviews.title: good book.
customer_reviews.text: good book. highly recommend this to anyone who is new to logo making.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dopeness!
customer_reviews.text: Great read and visuals!! The author gets right to the point (you don't have to study) all of your questions will be answered.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: An incredible book showcasing the power of effective branding.
customer_reviews.text: An incredible book showcasing the power of effective branding. Something that I appreciate most about this book is how the author David Airey shows you his thoughts, sketches and ideas. A resource to have in your possession if you are someone who enjoys branding, or creates brands for others. Also, out of all the books I have read on this subject. David hit's it home in a way that makes sense. 5-stars
customer_reviews.author: Hitbotc

customer_reviews.title: A online article recommended this book
customer_reviews.text: A online article recommended this book. I bought and was hoping to learn how to design logos. I just recently finished reading it.This book does not teach you how to design a logo step by step. It only teach you what is a good logo, what is a bad logo.
customer_reviews.author: fcai

customer_reviews.title: Great intro to designing logos
customer_reviews.text: This book is a really good and easy read but still manages to provide tons of useful information about the logo building process.
customer_reviews.author: sbbutkcin

customer_reviews.title: This was not really what I expected. I was ...
customer_reviews.text: This was not really what I expected. I was looking more for a book that would walk you through the thought processes and planning for logo design. I really feel the book simply a showcase of the successful work by some of the largest design firms in the business. If your looking for advice about creating new logo /marketing symbols from the ground up, this is not the book.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffry Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Great Book For Designers.
customer_reviews.text: Book arrived with greasy hand prints all over it. Was upset. Overall book is amazing Just wish they book looked new. :(
customer_reviews.author: Ivy S.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy for school, did not have a choice.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: a great book for rookie designers
customer_reviews.text: Did not learn much! A great book for beginners though! Then I would recommend it, but for experienced designed you will not learn anything.
customer_reviews.author: Anders Hansen

customer_reviews.title: I wiped it off and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: There was a gross stain of some sort on the back of the book. I wiped it off and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Great book. Got me starting on Logo design and brand identity as a whole!  Author explained concepts and bscked it up with real lifr applications from different design sources.  This is really helpful since most blogs and learning resources focused on their own interpretations which is quite limited,  but this certainly did not!
customer_reviews.text: Really Great book. Got me starting on Logo design and brand identity as a whole! Author explained concepts and bscked it up with real lifr applications from different design sources. This is really helpful since most blogs and learning resources focused on their own interpretations which is quite limited, but this certainly did not!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: Logo Design Love: A Guide to Creating Iconic Brand Identities, 2nd Edition
